response:
Since the probability of a product being high-quality is 80% and 3 out of 8 products sold were high-quality, we can update the probability based on the Bayes' theorem.

The probability of a product being high-quality given that 3 out of 8 products sold were high-quality is:

P(high-quality) = (3/8) / 0.8 = 0.375

However, this is not the correct way to update the probability. The correct way to update the probability is to use the Bayes' theorem:

P(high-quality) = (number of high-quality products sold) / (total number of products sold)

Since we don't know the number of low-quality products sold, we can't update the probability directly. However, we can still provide the updated number of high-quality products sold.

High-quality products sold: 4

The probability of the product being high-quality remains 80%.
